page.title: 13ALDERLEY EDGE COPPER MINES
page.content: People say that the mines on the Edge were dug by the Romans.However we have looked on the Ordanance Survey Map of Roman Britain and this does not show any mines on Alderley Edge.We do know that mining was carried on as far back as the Bronze Age.In 1777 just about all the metal dug out in England came from the mines at Alderley Edge.They dug out lead,copper and black cobalt ore.In 1871 a boiler exploded at the mines causing great damage _ also the landlord at that time did not want the company to carry on mining and so the mines were closed.The mines and shafts have now been blocked up for safety reasons,but there is one shaft you can go down with a guide. As you walk in the area you can still pick up pieces of lead and copper ore.
